org.springframework.data.gemfire.util

Class StreamUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.data.gemfire.util.StreamUtils

  • public abstract class StreamUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    The StreamUtils class is a abstract utility class for working with Streams.
    Since:
    2.0.2
    See Also:
    Stream

      • concat

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> concat(java.util.stream.Stream<T>... streams)
        Concatenates an array of Streams into a single, continuous Stream.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of elements in the Streams.
        Parameters:
        streams - array of Streams to concatenate.
        Returns:
        the concatenated array of Streams as a single, continuous Stream.
        See Also:
        Stream

      • nullSafeCount

        public static long nullSafeCount(java.util.stream.Stream<?> stream)
        Null-safe utility method used to return a count of the number of elements in the given Stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream of elements to count.
        Returns:
        a count of the number of elements in the Stream.
        See Also:
        Stream.count(), nullSafeStream(Stream)

      • nullSafeIsEmpty

        public static boolean nullSafeIsEmpty(java.util.stream.Stream<?> stream)
        Null-safe utility method used to determine whether the given Stream is empty.
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream to evalute.
        Returns:
        a boolean value indicating whether the given Stream is empty.
        See Also:
        Stream, nullSafeCount(Stream)

      • nullSafeStream

        public static <T> java.util.stream.Stream<T> nullSafeStream(java.util.stream.Stream<T> stream)
        Utility method used to guard against null Streams.
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of the elements in the Stream.
        Parameters:
        stream - Stream to evaluate.
        Returns:
        the given Stream if not null or an empty Stream.
        See Also:
        Stream
